headline.content: Full-stack developer building with React, Next.js, and AI/RAG systems. Army medic discipline + 7 years in automotive finance taught me to solve problems under pressure and deliver results.

short.content: Full-stack developer who spent 5 years as an Army paramedic and 7 years climbing Toyota's ranks. Now I build software with the same intensity I brought to keeping people alive.

medium.content: Former Army paramedic → Toyota Finance Manager → Full-stack developer. I bring the same discipline that kept patients alive and earned promotions to building software that works. I build production applications with React, Next.js, and AI/RAG systems. My background means I understand both the engineering and the "why does this matter."

linkedin_about.content:
Full-stack developer who builds applications from the ground up, frontend to backend to deployment.

I can take your idea from concept to live product. That means responsive interfaces in React and Next.js, APIs in Node.js, databases that scale, and infrastructure that doesn't break at 2am. When AI makes sense for your project, I build RAG systems with semantic search, vector databases, and responses grounded in your data.

Need data from somewhere it doesn't want to go? I build web scraping pipelines that collect, clean, and feed information into whatever system needs it. Need manual processes to disappear? I write automation that handles the repetitive work so your team can focus on what matters.

What I bring beyond the technical:

I ask the right questions before writing code. Years of high-pressure decision-making taught me that understanding the problem saves everyone time and money. I think about who's using what I build, not just whether it works, but whether it makes sense to them.

I communicate clearly because I've spent years translating complex information for people who aren't technical. I document my work so the next person isn't guessing. I meet deadlines because I've worked in environments where missing them wasn't an option.

If you're looking for a developer who ships reliable software and is genuinely easy to work with, let's connect. I'd love to hear what you're building.

resume_bullets: Built production e-commerce platform with over 160 React components, over 70 API routes, over 20 public + over 15 admin pages using Next.js and TypeScript. Implemented over 5 context providers for state management and Tailwind CSS for responsive design

Building experimental automation dashboard (bridgette-automation) with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and React for custom developer workflow tooling. Built WCAG AA accessible UI following semantic HTML, proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus management. Component-based architecture with reusable patterns and custom hooks for shared logic

Maintained three-branch deployment workflow (dev → testing → production) with GitHub Actions CI/CD running tests and accessibility checks on every PR. Over 1,335 commits demonstrating consistent production work
Client: Acadio (EdTech) — Started as API contractor, proved value through clean code and reliable delivery, expanded to technical operations over 9 months
descriptions.resume_summary: E-commerce platform: Complete system with shopping flows, user authentication, order management, admin dashboard, and component-based page builder so non-technical users can create pages without code. Built with a layered architecture that handles traffic, business logic, and data separately, making the system faster and easier to maintain. Smart indexing ensures pages load quickly by only updating what's changed.

sales_specialist.title: Sales Specialist
bullets: Consulted with customers on the sales floor to understand needs and present vehicle options, then guided them through the complete purchase process
Closed sales deals by walking customers through financing options, payment structures, and loan terms across multiple lenders
Handled finance and insurance work including payment plans, extended warranties, GAP insurance, and protection products
Built strong customer relationships in fast-paced environment, generating repeat business and referrals
Worked with diverse customer backgrounds and credit situations, explaining complex financial concepts clearly
Maintained top-third performance rankings for both sales volume and customer satisfaction

resume_bullets: Worked at high-volume dealership moving 10-30 cars daily for seven years, handling multiple customer interactions and complex transactions
Worked with 3-7 customers daily, walking them through their options and putting together financing across different lenders
Built trust with customers by explaining options clearly. Became the go-to person when teammates had complicated deals
descriptions.application_description:
Seven years at a high-volume Toyota store where the team processed 10-30 deals daily. I earned three promotions by consistently delivering results, finishing as Finance Manager handling 3-7 customers per day. I know how to present protection products, structure deals across multiple lenders, and keep transactions compliant without slowing things down.

Customers left my office feeling good about their decisions because I explained options clearly instead of pushing products. Teammates brought me their complicated deals because I could find solutions. You're getting someone who performs under pressure, earns trust quickly, and makes the department run smoother.
descriptions.linkedin:
Seven years, three roles, one lesson: earn trust by showing up and solving problems.

I started on the sales floor and worked my way to Finance Manager — not by chasing titles, but by consistently delivering for customers and teammates. Each promotion came from doing the current job well enough that the next one made sense.

What I did:

• Guided customers through one of the biggest financial decisions of their lives — listening first, explaining clearly, and helping them feel confident rather than pressured

• Managed complex financial transactions, compliance requirements, and lending relationships while keeping the customer experience smooth

• Built systems and processes that made the department run better — the same instinct I now bring to writing clean, maintainable code

• Mentored teammates and became the person people came to when deals got complicated

What I took with me:

The ability to translate complex information for people who aren't experts. Patience with problems that don't have obvious answers. A deep respect for the person on the other side of the table.

These skills didn't disappear when I switched careers — they're the foundation of how I build software today.
descriptions.brief: 7 years advancing from sales to finance leadership

key_accomplishments: Three promotions in 7 years at high-volume dealership (300-600+ units/month)
3-7 F&I deals per day: VSC, GAP, maintenance plans, ancillary products

descriptions.application_description: Started working with international students, then moved to the Military department because my Army background gave me credibility with veterans navigating the transition to civilian life. Helped service members and their families understand GI Bill benefits, program costs, and how to make education work around military obligations. Same skill set I used in F&I: breaking down complex financial information so people can make confident decisions.
resume_bullets: Started in International Admissions, then moved to Military Student Services where my Army background gave me credibility with veterans navigating civilian life
Guided service members and families through GI Bill benefits, program costs, and fitting education around military schedules
descriptions.linkedin:
Started in the International department helping prospective students from around the world navigate the admissions process. These conversations required patience, cultural awareness, and the ability to explain complex US education systems to families making decisions from thousands of miles away.

After proving I could connect with diverse audiences, moved to the Military department as a Student Liaison. This role felt personal — I'd served in the Army as a paramedic, so I understood what service members face when transitioning to civilian life.

Helped veterans, active-duty personnel, and their families understand how to use their GI Bill benefits, navigate program requirements, and plan their education around military obligations. These weren't just enrollment conversations — they were career transition conversations.

What I learned here shows up in my development work today: listening before talking, translating complex information into plain language, and understanding that behind every question is someone trying to make a better life for themselves.

Consistently met enrollment goals while maintaining integrity. No high-pressure tactics — just honest guidance and genuine support.
descriptions.brief: Guided students through educational decisions, specializing in international and military student support

linkedin_posts.title: Developer Introduction
linkedin_posts.content:
You probably have a dozen technical problems that aren't getting solved because your team is stretched thin.

I specialize in being the person who takes those problems off your plate.

---

Here's what I do well:

• Build e-commerce platforms (checkout flows, payment processing, order management)

• Automate manual workflows that waste your team's time

• Integrate AI features that add value (RAG systems, semantic search, chatbots)

• Write tests so bugs get caught before customers see them

• Communicate in plain language, no jargon walls

---

Recent work:

Complete e-commerce platform with AI chatbot, appointment booking, and admin dashboards.

Comprehensive test coverage with unit, integration, and E2E tests covering the full user journey.

---

What makes me different:

My background (Army paramedic to Toyota Finance Manager to Full-stack developer) means I understand both the technical work and the business reasons behind it.

If you're tired of developers who over-promise and under-deliver, let's talk. I'd rather show you what I've built than tell you what I can do.

acadio: Primary technical problem-solver on engineering team
Content tools for SIE/Series-7 exam preparation
Web scraping infrastructure for FINRA regulations
needthisdone: Redis caching layer for fast page loads
WCAG AA accessibility compliance across all components
Three-tier architecture with independent service scaling
Context-aware chatbots using pgvector semantic search
previous_projects: Flashcard management system with automated creation and validation
JavaScript solitaire game: OOP state management, algorithm implementation
Full-stack client projects: Node.js, Express, database design
Python automation: Excel/XLSX processing, data transformation

role_specific_intros.backend_architecture: Through my independent consulting work, I demonstrated the problem-solving and architectural thinking your team needs. My largest client engagement was Acadio (EdTech), where I built an automated flashcard generation system that reduced manual content creation from weeks to minutes through thoughtful system design and modern tooling integration.
role_specific_intros.fullstack_devops: My experience building needthisdone.com demonstrates the full-stack and DevOps expertise your team is seeking. The architecture uses Next.js with Supabase and Redis for data and caching.
role_specific_intros.frontend_design: I have built responsive React and Vue.js applications demonstrating strong front-end fundamentals. In my work at needthisdone.com, I implemented WCAG AA accessibility compliance across all components and comprehensive E2E testing with Playwright.
role_specific_intros.ai_integration: I have successfully integrated modern AI tooling into production applications. During my Acadio client engagement, I used Claude Code to build systems that dramatically reduced manual work. On needthisdone.com, I implemented context-aware chatbots using Supabase pgvector semantic search and OpenAI embeddings, demonstrating practical understanding of RAG patterns and LLM integration.
role_specific_intros.it_support_helpdesk: Years of solo development have made me a self-sufficient troubleshooter across software, hardware, and systems. When something breaks, I diagnose and fix it. I have hands-on experience with remote support tools like TeamViewer and Remote Desktop, and my background explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences (7 years in automotive finance, 5 years in admissions) means I can communicate clearly with end users while resolving their issues efficiently.

influences.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
influences.author: David Thomas & Andrew Hunt
influences.impact: Why I fix the small stuff before it becomes big stuff. Broken windows invite more broken windows.

influences.title: Algorithms to Live By

influences.impact: Sometimes good enough now beats perfect later. Knowing when to stop optimizing is its own skill.

influences.title: Never Split the Difference
influences.author: Chris Voss
influences.impact: Hard conversations get easier when you stop trying to win and start trying to understand.

influences.title: Seven Principles for Making Marriage Work

influences.impact: What keeps marriages together keeps teams together: fix things fast, assume good intent, stay curious about the people you work with.
